function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code currently uses an in-memory dictionary to store the shortened URLs. This means that if the server is restarted, all data will be lost. A better approach would be to use a persistent database to store the URLs. This would ensure that the data is not lost when the server is restarted and would also allow for better scalability if the number of URLs grows large.

message.content: The tests are failing because the URLs are expiring immediately after they are created. This is because the expiration time is set to the current time. To fix this, the expiration time should be set to a future time. This will allow the URLs to be valid for a certain period of time after they are created.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The tests are failing because the expiration time is not being correctly parsed in the application code. The application is expecting the expiration time to be in the format '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S', but the tests are providing the expiration time in a different format, which includes microseconds. To fix this, the application code should be updated to correctly parse the expiration time format provided by the tests.
